concise_definition: conj. 虽然, 尽管; adv. 然而, 不过

definitions.explanation_en: Used to introduce a clause that contrasts with or seems to contradict the main clause, expressing concession or contrast.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用于引导一个与主句形成对比或看似矛盾的从句，表达让步或转折关系。
definitions.example_en: Though it was raining, we decided to go for a walk.
definitions.example_cn: 虽然下着雨，我们还是决定去散步。

definitions.explanation_en: Used at the end of a sentence to introduce a contrasting or qualifying idea, often in informal speech.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用于句末，引入一个对比性或限定性的观点，常用于非正式口语中。
definitions.example_en: I enjoyed the movie; it was long, though.
definitions.example_cn: 我挺喜欢这部电影的，就是有点长。

comparison.analysis: “Although” 与 “though” 在引导让步状语从句时意义几乎完全相同，但 “although” 更正式，通常不用于句末作副词；而 “though” 更口语化，且可作副词单独使用，用法更灵活。
“Even though” 是 “though” 的加强形式，语气更强，强调对比的强烈程度，常用于突出意料之外的让步关系。例如：Even though he was tired, he kept working. 而 “though” 语气较中性，不带强调色彩。
“But” 是并列连词，用于连接两个对立的分句，表达直接的转折；而 “though” 引导的是从句，语气更委婉，常用于让步而非直接对立。例如：It was cold, but we went out.（直接转折） vs. It was cold, though we went out.（让步语气）
